SEARCH

Package com.syncura360.controller

package com.syncura360.controller
Contains REST API controllers responsible for handling HTTP requests and responses.
  • Related Packages
    Package
    Description
    com.syncura360
    Provides the core classes for the Syncura360 application.
    com.syncura360.dto
    Defines Data Transfer Objects (DTOs) used for carrying data between layers or across API boundaries.
    com.syncura360.model
    Contains the core domain model classes (entities, value objects) representing application data structures.
    com.syncura360.repository
    Defines repository interfaces and implementations for data access and persistence operations.
    com.syncura360.security
    Includes classes related to application security, such as configuration, authentication, and authorization.
    com.syncura360.service
    Implements the core business logic and orchestration layer, coordinating actions between controllers and repositories.
  • Class
    Description
    DrugController
    Controller for managing drugs in the inventory.
    LoginController
    Handles all incoming login requests.
    LoginController.LoginResponse
    DTO for login response.
    PatientController
    Controller for managing patient-related operations.
    RegController
    Handles hospital registration and initialization of head admin credentials.
    RoomController
    Handles room-related operations for hospitals, including adding, modifying, removing, and fetching room details.
    ScheduleController
    Handles CRUD operations for staff scheduling.
    ScheduleController.MessageResponse
    Models a simple response with only a string message.
    ServicesController
    Controller responsible for handling services-related operations such as creating, updating, deleting, and retrieving services in a hospital.
    StaffController
    Controller responsible for handling CRUD operations on staff credentials.
    StaffController.AllStaffDTO
    DTO for a list of staff information.
    StaffController.StaffUpdateResponse
    DTO to model the response containing successfully updated staff records.
